item.title: Media queries to adjust web page layout
item.description: (You: I have this div which is showing all the elements in the div alongside each other.) <div class="input_container"> <label for="stock_symbol"></label><input id="stock_symbol" type="text"><br> <button id="submit_stock" type="submit" value="Submit" py-click="show_stock()">Show Details</button> <ul> <li> <a href="https://github.com/namuan/lazy-trader" target="_blank" aria-label="Github">Github</a> </li> <li> <a href="https://x.com/namuan_twt/" target="_blank" aria-label="Twitter">Twitter</a> </li> </ul> </div> how can I make sure that it renders correctly on a mobile screen? ChatGPT: To ensure that the elements in the <div> are displayed correctly on a mobile screen, you can use media queries in your CSS to apply different styles based on the width of the viewport.

item.title: Styling Lazy Trader
item.description: Conversation with ChatGPT when developing Lazy Trader You: In plain css, I want the label, input box and the button to appear in a single row in the middle of the screen. ChatGPT: To create a layout with a label, input box, and button in a single row in the middle of the screen using CSS, you can use the display: flex property to create a flex container, the justify-content: center property to center the elements horizontally, and the align-items: center property to center the elements vertically.
